info.title: Geographic Site
info.description:
## TMF API Reference : TMF 674 - Place - Geographic Site Management

### Release : 19.5 - November 2019

get.description: This operation list or find GeographicSite entities

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: A secure token chain that indicates that it is an authorized request.

parameters.name: correlatorId
parameters.description:
NB ID used to match the request with its corresponding SB asynchronous notification. The format should be like below: 
 ASPID+yyyyMMddHHmmss+sequence(5 digits) 
 Note:+ means concat 
 The ASPID is the M2M indentifer, and its length is maximum 21 characters 
 yyyyMMddHHmmss is the UTC time format. 
 Sequence is an increased sequence, and its length is 5 digits.the sequence should be started with 00001 and end with 99999. 
 Example: TP000002322017022409365100021

parameters.name: messageId
parameters.description: Transaction identity for each request

parameters.name: requestDate
parameters.description: Time and date the request is sent

parameters.name: targetSystem
parameters.description: The system where targets the request.

parameters.name: originSystem
parameters.description: The system where is originated the request.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Indicates the country to route. ISO 1366 – 3 character Example: MEX

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the place

parameters.name: relatedParty.id
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the relatedParty

parameters.name: relatedParty.identifierType
parameters.description: Identifier type of the relatedParty

parameters.name: relatedParty.role
parameters.description: Role of the relatedParty

originSystem.description: The system where is originated the request.

requestDate.description: Time and date the request is sent

targetSystem.description: The system where targets the request.

day.description: Day where the calendar status applies (e.g.: monday, mon-to-fri, weekdays, weekend, all week, ...)

status.description: Indication of the availability of the site (e.g.: open)

timeZone.description: Indication of the timezone applicable to the calendar information (e.g.: Paris, GMT+1)

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

GeographicAddressValidationRef.title: GeographicAddressValidationRef

id.description: Unique identifier of the Address Validation

externalId.description: External identifier of the Address Validation

status.description: Status of the address validation (inProgress, terminatedWithErrror, done).

createDateTime.description: Date when the address validation was create

lastUpdateDateTime.description: Date when the address validation was updated by last time

createdBy.description: the user that creates the address validation

lastUpdateBy.description: the user that updates the address validation by last time

@type.description: Indicates the type of the resource.

@schemaLocation.description: Link to schema describing this REST resource.

GeographicAddressValidationRef.description:
Resource used to support a request for a validation address : check if a geographic address described by values attributes exists)
If exist, id and href are provided
if not, alternate address(es) could be provided

code.description: A code that may be used for some addressing schemes eg: [ANSI T1.253-1999]

description.description: Text describing additional information regarding the site

name.description: A user-friendly name for the place, such as [Paris Store], [London Store], [Main Home]

status.description: The condition of the GeographicSite, such as planned, underConstruction, cancelled, active, inactive, former

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

GeographicPoint.title: GeographicPoint
GeographicPoint.description: A GeographicPoint defines a geographic point through coordinates.

GeographicLocation.title: GeographicLocation

geometryType.description: Type allows describing Geolocation form: it could be a point, a line, a polygon, a cylinder, etc....

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing this REST Resource

GeographicLocation.description: A GeographicLocation allows describing through coordinate(s) a point, a line or a space

GeographicSubAddress.title: GeographicSubAddress

type.description: Type of subAddress : it can be a subunit or a private street

name.description: Name of the subAddress to identify it with a meaningful identification

subUnitType.description:
The type of subunit
e.g.BERTH, FLAT, PIER, SUITE, SHOP, TOWER, UNIT, WHARF.

subUnitNumber.description:
The discriminator used for the subunit
often just a simple number e.g. FLAT 5, may also be a range

levelType.description: Describes level types within a building

levelNumber.description: Used where a level type may be repeated e.g. BASEMENT 1, BASEMENT 2

buildingName.description: Allows for buildings that have well-known names

privateStreetNumber.description: Private streets numbers internal to a private street

privateStreetName.description: Private streets internal to a property (e.g. a university) may have internal names that are not recorded by the land title office

@type.description: Type of the resource for this subAdress

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing this REST Resource

GeographicSubAddress.description: It is used for addressing within a property in an urban area (country properties are often defined differently). It may refer to a building, a building cluster, or a floor of a multistory building.

GeographicAddress.title: GeographicAddress

externalId.description: Unique identifier of the address in an external system

href.description: An URI used to access to the address resource

streetNr.description: Number identifying a specific property on a public street. It may be combined with streetNrLast for ranged addresses

streetName.description: Name of the street or other street type

postcode.description: Descriptor for a postal delivery area, used to speed and simplify the delivery of mail (also known as zipcode)

@type.description: Indicates the type of the resource. Here can be 'UrbanPropertyAddress', ‘FormattedAddress’, ‘JapanesePropertyAddress’ , ‘AustralianPropertyAddress’, etc…

@schemaLocation.description: A Link to the schema describing this REST Resource. The resource described 'UrbanPropertyAddress' but a schema could be used for other property address description.

GeographicAddress.description: A geographic address is a structured textual way of describing how to find a Property in an urban area (country properties are often defined differently)

GeographicAddressSpec.title: GeographicAddressSpec

href.description: An URI used to access to the address resource

@type.description: Indicates the type of the resource. Here can be 'UrbanPropertyAddress', ‘FormattedAddress’, ‘JapanesePropertyAddress’ , ‘AustralianPropertyAddress’, etc…

@schemaLocation.description: A Link to the schema describing this REST Resource. The resource described 'UrbanPropertyAddress' but a schema could be used for other property address description.

GeographicAddressSpec.description: A geographic address is a structured textual way of describing how to find a Property in an urban area (country properties are often defined differently)

Characteristic.title: Characteristic
Characteristic.description: Name/value pairs, used to extra characterized the Area

Area.title: Area

name.description: The defined name of the municipality

Area.description: Area corresponds to a geographic area as a city, a locality, a district, etc

endHour.description: The time when the status ends applying

startHour.description: The time when the status starts applying

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

id.description: Unique identifier of a related entity.

identifierType.description: Identifier Type of a related entity.

role.description: Role played by the related party

@baseType.description: When sub-classing, this defines the super-class

@schemaLocation.description: A URI to a JSON-Schema file that defines additional attributes and relationships

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class entity name

@referredType.description: The actual type of the target instance when needed for disambiguation.

RelatedParty.description: Related Entity reference. A related party defines party or party role linked to a specific entity.

DetailResType.title: DetailResType

severityLevel.description: Ifentifies the severity of the transaction

description.description: Text that explains the reason for error.

DetailResType.description: Error defined for detail the fault

GenericFault.title: GenericFault

latency.description: Time of the operation execution in milliseconds

GenericFault.description: Error defined for detail the fault

ErrorListType.title: ErrorListType
ErrorListType.description: List with the detail of the faults
